alert.note: Alert for Lee; Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 12:40PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lee and northwestern Phillips Counties through 130 PM CST... At 1240 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Charles, or 12 miles southwest of Marvell, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marvell, Lexa, Rondo, Aubrey, Watkins Corner, Lagrange, Poplar Grove, Big Creek Corner, Barton, Latour, Kindall, Phillips Bayou, Turkey Scratch, Vineyard, Kingtown, Thomasville, Gobell, Trenton, Cypress Corner and Cypert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
